chargeHist.descr: OWI (5th or 6th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: OWI (5th or 6th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Neil OFlanagan

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: EZ. Defendant Christopher Neil OFlanagan in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Edward Weil in court for Christopher Neil OFlanagan.  Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of the Information.  Not guilty plea entered.
Hearing scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Clerk: EZ. Defendant Christopher Neil OFlanagan in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Edward Weil in court for Christopher Neil OFlanagan.  Prosecuting attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin. Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial and State shall file an Information.  Atty. Weil moves for bond modification to $750.00 cash bond.  State opposes bond modification.  Court states the bond as set is appropriate at this time and states in event blood test results take longer to come back can be revisited.
Arraignment scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Maintain absolute sobriety. No contact with T.W.K. or J.M.W.

Clerk: EZ. Defendant Christopher Neil OFlanagan appeared by video, in custody at WC Jail.  Attorney Laykin Stone in court for Christopher Neil OFlanagan.  Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  (22FA229)  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Defendant waives to appear in person.  Defendant not eligible for State Public Defender.  State requests $4,000-5,000.00 cash bond.  Atty. Stone requests a signature bond.  Court orders $2,000.00 cash bond.  Defendant states will not be able to post and requests signature bond or $500.00 cash bond.  Court advises bond can be revisited.  Preliminary hearing time limits NOT waived.  Defendant states will be unemployed as of tomorrow.  Defendant referred to State Public Defender.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 3, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
